math_4.subject: math
math_4.title: Grade 4 Math Diagnostic
math_4.description: Placement assessment for multiplication, fractions, place value, and geometry basics.

items.prompt: What is 7 × 8?
What is 63 ÷ 9?
A baker has 24 cookies. She puts them equally into 4 bags. How many cookies are in each bag?
What is 12 × 5?
There are 5 shelves with 9 books on each shelf. How many books are there in all?
Which fraction is equivalent to 1/2?
Which is greater: 3/4 or 2/3?
What is 1/4 + 2/4?
A pizza is cut into 8 equal slices. If you eat 2 slices, what fraction of the pizza did you eat?
Which fraction is the smallest?
What is the value of the 5 in 3,567?
Round 4,782 to the nearest hundred.
Which number is greater: 2,456 or 2,465?
How many sides does a pentagon have?
A rectangle has a length of 8 cm and a width of 3 cm. What is its perimeter?
What is the area of a square with sides of 5 inches?
Which shape has exactly 4 right angles?

ela_4.subject: ela
ela_4.title: Grade 4 ELA Diagnostic
ela_4.description: Reading comprehension, main idea, vocabulary, and basic grammar.

items.prompt: Read: 'Maya loved visiting her grandmother's farm. She helped feed the chickens every morning and collected eggs from the henhouse.' Why did Maya visit the farm?

options.text: To help her grandmother with chores
Because she loved visiting her grandmother

items.prompt: Read: 'The dog wagged its tail and licked Sam's face. Sam laughed and hugged the puppy.' How did Sam feel?
Read: 'Bears sleep all winter. This is called hibernation. They eat a lot in fall to prepare.' What is hibernation?
Read: 'The library was quiet. Everyone whispered because loud talking wasn't allowed.' Where does this take place?
Read: 'First, Alex washed the apples. Then, she cut them into pieces. Finally, she made applesauce.' What did Alex do first?
Read: 'Jake practiced piano every day after school. His recital was in one week.' Why was Jake practicing so much?

options.text: He had a recital coming up

items.prompt: What is the MAIN idea? 'Bees are very important. They help flowers grow by spreading pollen. Without bees, we would have fewer fruits and vegetables.'
What is the MAIN idea? 'Recycling helps the Earth. When we recycle paper, we save trees. Recycling plastic keeps it out of the ocean.'
Which detail BEST supports the main idea 'Exercise is good for you'?
What is the MAIN idea? 'Drinking water is important. Your body needs water to stay healthy. You should drink several glasses every day.'
What does 'enormous' mean?
Read: 'The children were exhausted after playing all day.' What does 'exhausted' mean?
What does 'ancient' mean?
Read: 'The fox was clever and tricked the other animals.' What does 'clever' mean?
Which sentence is correct?
Choose the correct plural: 'The ___ are playing outside.'
Which word is a noun?
Choose the correct past tense: 'Yesterday, I ___ to the store.'

science_4.subject: science
science_4.title: Grade 4 Science Diagnostic
science_4.description: Life cycles, matter, weather, and simple machines.

items.prompt: What is the life cycle of a butterfly in order?
What do plants need to grow?
A frog starts life as a ___.
Which animal lays eggs?
What are the three states of matter?
What happens to water when it freezes?
Which is an example of a gas?
When water boils, it turns into ___.
Which of these is a solid?
What causes rain?

options.text: Water in clouds falls to Earth

items.prompt: What is the water cycle?

options.text: How water moves from Earth to sky and back

items.prompt: Which season is typically the coldest?
What tool measures temperature?
Which is a simple machine?
A ramp is an example of which simple machine?
What does a lever help you do?

options.text: Lift or move things more easily

items.prompt: A seesaw on a playground is an example of a ___.
A doorknob is an example of which simple machine?
